chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee V. Richards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant entitled to 110 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (4/11/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or request a payment plan within said time.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer privileges to Milwaukee County to commence forthwith.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

(11:25) Defendant Lee V. Richards in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def.'s brother and friend are also present; Judge Voigt appears by video; parties are prepared with P&S; Atty. Weil will be arguing for probation; State heard on recomm. (110 days credit); Atty. Weil has GPQPA & WOR - to be faxed to Judge; cont. with hearing; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to Count 1 Take and Drive w/o Consent; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made KF&V and finds Def. guilty of Count 1 w/Count 2 D&RI; State heard; Atty. Weil heard; State opposes expungement; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Atty. Weil notes that Def. agreed to do this hearing via video; Def. remanded

**W/H - 3 years PO - 110 days credit if revoked
- 60 days in DCJ w/H&T to Milwaukee County to comm. forthwith
- $268 CC
- $250 DNA and sample

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Bortz Wild Goose Auto Sales, W5905 Hwy 33, Horicon WI or the owners Gary & Deb Bortz or their residence.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $109.44 by next court date.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Defendant Lee V. Richards in court, in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Missed P&S in April 2015. Discussion held. Court will reset P&S with Judge Voigt's Assistant. Court sets $50,000 Cash bond with conditions:   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.   Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $109.44 by next court date. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Any other conditions as previously imposed.

Judge Voigt appeared via phone (video was unable to connect) Recorded in Columbia County.  ADA James Sempf appeared for the State; Attorney Matthew Weil appeared for defendant.  Defendant did not appear.  Bond is revoked, forfeiture of the $1,000, and a warrant is authorized.  Dodge County to prepare the orders.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lee V. Richards in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  Intern Holdahl under the supervison of James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
